edu.cornell.gdiac.starstruck.Obstacles

Class PlanetList

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cornell.gdiac.starstruck.Obstacles.PlanetList

  • public class PlanetList
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance represents a list of the planets in one level. Implements iterable. Stores texture files, so that different galaxy themes can be selected.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      PlanetList(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 scale)
      Constructs a new PlanetList by loading the appropriate sprites

      • addPlanet

        public void addPlanet(float x,
                      float y,
                      int i,
                      com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.World world,
                      VectorWorld vectorWorld,
                      Bug bug)
        Add planet i centered at (x,y) to the planet list using World world and VectorWorld vectorWorld.
        Parameters:
        x - X coord of center of planet.
        y - Y coord of center of planet.
        i - Index of planet to create.
        world - World this planet exists in.
        vectorWorld - VectorWorld controlling gravity for this planet.

      • addPlanet

        public void addPlanet(com.badlogic.gdx.utils.JsonValue json,
                      com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.World world,
                      VectorWorld vectorWorld,
                      Bug buggy)
        Add the planet specified by JsonValue json to the PlanetList using World world and VectorWorld vectorWorld.
        Parameters:
        json - JsonValue containing data for the planet to be added.
        world - World this planet exists in.
        vectorWorld - VectorWorld controlling gravity for this planet.

      • toNearest

        public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 toNearest(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 pos)
        Finds and returns the direction of the planet with the nearest surface Assumes that planetList is not empty
        Parameters:
        pos - The point at which to find the nearest planet

      • toJson

        public com.badlogic.gdx.utils.JsonValue toJson()
        Write this astronaut to a JsonValue. When parsed, this JsonValue should return the same planetList.
        Returns:
        A JsonValue representing this planetList.
